issue.title: ignition-gazebo major version is hard-coded in plugin filenames in sdf files

content.raw:
> I would consider trying to install to a versioned folder first

~~I hadn't considered this, but it seems a bit dangerous to me since different versions will overwrite each other. Gazebo will look for the plugins in the folder that matches its own version, so I think we're safe installing unversioned libs into versioned directories.~~ Bah sorry, I read **unversioned** :grimacing:

> CMake is perfectly happy to have library targets produce an .so file with a name that's different from the target name.

Thanks for the confirmation. I'll keep working on the symlink option for now since I already started it, but I can revisit the `CUSTOM_LIB_NAME` idea if the symlink doesn't work.
content.html:
I would consider trying to install to a versioned folder first

I hadn't considered this, but it seems a bit dangerous to me since different versions will overwrite each other. Gazebo will look for the plugins in the folder that matches its own version, so I think we're safe installing unversioned libs into versioned directories. Bah sorry, I read unversioned

CMake is perfectly happy to have library targets produce an .so file with a name that's different from the target name.

Thanks for the confirmation. I'll keep working on the symlink option for now since I already started it, but I can revisit the CUSTOM_LIB_NAME idea if the symlink doesn't work.
